intro: Detandra paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense Detandra, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Detandra paraensis is often found growing in moist, shaded environments within the dense canopy of the rainforest.
